entry.title: Rails Course for Newbies
entry.content:
Basics of rails

  • What is MVC in Rails
  • What is Ruby on Rails
  • Ruby on Rails windows environment setup​(See only if student uses Windows)
  • Ruby on Rails linux environment setup​(See only if student uses Linux)
  • Git and Heroku ­ Part 1
  • Git and Heroku ­ Part 2
  • Git and Heroku ­ Part 3
  • Rails Application framework structure
  • Database Planning and Model Creating​­ Part 1
  • Database Planning and Model Creating​­ Part 2
  • Model Associations
  • Read From Database
  • Database ­ Create and Update​­ Part 1
  • Database ­ Create and Update​­ Part 2
  • Scaffolding in Rails
  • Linking multiple models
  • HTML and CSS ­ Intro to Layouts
  • Static Pages and Navigation
  • Integrating and Rendering HTML CSS ­ Part 1
  • Integrating and Rendering HTML CSS ­ Part 2

Ruby gems and it’s uses

  • Introduction to Devise Gem
  • Customizing Devise Gem
  • Omniauth ­ Part 1
  • Omniauth ­ Part 2
  • Facebook Authentication
  • Omniauth Identity​(Normal login without Devise)
  • Authorization using CanCan

Understanding views and layouts

  • All about layouts
  • Layouts and content_for
  • Understanding content_for by changing page title dynamically
  • Looping through Flash messages
  • Formatting Time
  • Building a plugin
  • Custom form field error
  • Catch all routes
  • Pagination (will_paginate)
  • Handling Exceptions
  • Debugging with ruby­debug
  • Presenters from Scratch

Advance model techniques

  • Strong parameters
  • Dynamic find methods
  • Fun with find condition
  • Virtual attributes
  • Using with_scope
  • Shortcut blocks with symbol to_proc
  • HABTM checkboxes
  • has_many :through association
  • STI and Polymorphic association
  • Eager Loading
  • Counter cache column
  • Bullet ­ Find inefficient queries

Leftover, but important

  • Client side performance
  • Memcached
  • Autocomplete search term
  • Dynamic forms
  • Uploading to Amazon S3
  • Sending Emails
